system.description:
Giant sage statues that pocked the grasslands of Ba-e gave Kadanay artifactsmiths ideas. They had too much fun. Now they ride these sage statue-shaped gold-and-jade armors, with four arms. A weaker form of the God Body.

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter. Check the book for higher ranks.)
system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Apat Kamay Strike. Attack an adjacent enemy with Bravery and then push 2.

Gambits [[/r d4]]

1: Rush > Inflict Violence > Rush

2: Rush > Inflict Violence > Pure Body [1]: Cleanse 1 status or gain Block 1.

3: Rush > Thunderclap [2]: Attack all enemies in an area (blast 3) with Bravery and they are blown wide open.

4: Rush > Textile Shattering Technique [2]: Attack all enemies in an area (line 6) with Bravery four times, ignoring Combo Breaker, but each attack must be made in each of the four cardinal directions.

traits.name: Conviction
traits.description: All Folk have a reason for fighting, and if reasoned to, can cause them to rethink combat. However, they will fight for their Conviction until it looks like all is bleak.

traits.name: Morale
traits.description: At the beginning of any Resound where there are twice as many Kadungganan than there are enemies (eg., If there are 4 Kadungganan and 2 Enemies left) all Folk enemies will Surrender, becoming Defeated.

traits.name: Turn The Wheel
traits.description: At the beginning of every Resound, all Ba-enense fighters gain 1 Merit, which they can gain up to 3 of. All Ba-enense add their current Merit as attack dice.

traits.name: Holy Form
traits.description:
Godwalkers wear golden armor powered by souls of overjoyous ancestor spirits, with four arms. As long as they have Merit, they
have +1 Parry against all attacks with Bravery. They can spend 1 Merit when a fighter leaves an adjacent square to inflict 1 True Hit to them
